{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Buffalo |model=WHR-300 |revision=HP |upc=747464126036 |ean= |asin=B0096239EC;US; |price= |est_release_date=09/05/2012 |fcc_date=07/21/2009 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Cameo |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=FDI-09101621-0 |ic_id=6102A-025 |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2.3 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR7240 |cpu1_cspeed=400 |fla1=4 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9283;AR9283-AL1A; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags=high power |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware=DD-WRT |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=BUFFALO-XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^BUFFALO-[A-F0-6]{6}$ |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=10:6F:3F |oui_eth=10:6F:3F }} {{TagLine|Buffalo AirStation HighPower N300 Wireless Router}} :{{TagLine|NFINITI HighPower Wireless Router}}
[http://www.buffalotech.com/products/wireless/single-band-wireless-routers/airstation-highpower-n300-wireless-router-2 Product page]
This device appears to be identical (or near identical) to the [[Buffalo WHR-HP-G300N|Buffalo WHR-HP-G300N]]. <!-- there is a v2? -->
===Additional external links=== *[http://www.speedguide.net/routers/buffalo-whr-300hp-airstation-highpower-n300-wireless-2535 On SpeedGuide.net]
===Probable PSU(s)=== The power supply shown in the above image is an ''Asian Power Devices'' WA-10H05FU. :The one shown in the FCC external photos is a ''Buffalo''-branded US100523.
[[File:Whr-300hp adaptor bottom.jpg|300px]] {{#set:Has images=external|Has images=power supply}}
===Third Party Firmware=== <small> The WHR-300HP ships with the Buffalo "User Friendly" firmware build, which will not install third-party firmware. *The Buffalo "Pro" firmware build must be installed on the WHR-300HP before upgrading to DD-WRT or any other third-party firmware.
:# Download and unzip the [http://www.buffalotech.com/support-and-downloads/download/whr-series_sw106.zip CD image for WHR Series wireless router] from Buffalo. :# Install the ''\whr-series_sw106\Firmware\WHR-300HP\Professional_v24sp2-19438.enc'' firmware image on the WHR-300HP. :# Doing this resets the WHR-300HP to factory defaults. (IP=192.168.11.1 Username=admin Password=password) :# Install a regular DD-WRT firmware image for the WHR-HP-G300N on the WHR-300HP. *Builds compatible with the WHR-HP-G300N: :-[ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/betas/2017/06-01-2017-r32170/buffalo_whr_hp_g300n/whr-hp-g300n-firmware-MULTI.bin DD-WRT v3.0-r32170 std (06/01/17)] :-[ftp://ftp.dd-wrt.com/betas/2017/04-06-2017-r31825/buffalo_whr_hp_g300n/whr-hp-g300n-firmware-MULTI.bin DD-WRT v3.0-r31825 std (04/06/17)] :N.B. The previously recommended build, (r24461) prevented upgrading or downgrading the firmware. If stuck, follow the fix instructions [http://www.askmeaboutlinux.com/?p=2819 here ]. *The [http://downloads.openwrt.org/barrier_breaker/14.07-rc2/ar71xx/generic/openwrt-ar71xx-generic-whr-hp-g300n-squashfs-factory.bin OpenWrt BarrierBreaker 14.07-rc2] build for the WHR-HP-G300N is compatible with the :WHR-300HP, but the internal flash is too small to install the Luci web management interface. </small>
__NOTOC__
